arm_group.description: Subjects that had previously received silver coated Foley catheters.
Subjects that received non-silver catheters from an ERASE CAUTI tray.

brief_summary.textblock:
The Foley catheter is one component in a catheter insertion procedure that  could contribute
      to a catheter associated urinary tract infection (CAUTI). Improvement in the catheter
      insertion procedures using the ERASE CAUTI Tray system may help to lower these infection
      rates.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Compare CAUTI Rates Following ERASE CAUTI Tray Non-Silver vs Silver Coated Foley Catheters

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  At least 18 years of age

          -  Received Either silver coated Foley catheter or ERASE CAUTI non-silver coated
             catheter

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  UTI present upon current hospital admission

          -  Burn patients, transplant patients, or immune-compromised patients.

clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Study to Compare the CAUTI Rates Following ERASE CAUTI Tray Non-Silver Coated Foley Catheters Verse Silver Coated Foley Catheters

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Urinary tract infection rates
primary_outcome.time_frame: 3-9 months based on size of ICU and catheter usage

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
